page.title: 05Housing in Willingham
page.content: There is a wide variety of styles of { {housing}in Willingham. The main High Street consists of ribbon development with some{19th C.}dwellings. Infilling is taking place on vacant plots with brick-built detached houses. Most of the houses in the village are privately owned. There are groups of {council houses}in Wilford Furlong, Haden Way, Fen End and Long Lane. The majority of houses are detached but there are some town houses in Long Lane and terraced houses in Fen End. Recently built houses have{tiled roofs whereas some of the older properties still have{thatch or slate roofs. The oldest house, in Church Street, dates back to the{17th C.}The commonest brick pattern is{Flemish {Bond.
